results.description: Combine value bought vs sold to capture net institutional dollar flow momentum. Applied SUGGESTION1: used two complementary fields (inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought, inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_sold). SUGGESTION2: not applicable (fields scalar). SUGGESTION3: coverage=1.0 so no ts_backfill. SUGGESTION4: both fields have high user/alpha counts (92/279 and 84/299) → strong signal. Confidence: 0.78

Ratio of institutional shares bought to sold to detect buying pressure. SUGGESTION1: used two fields. SUGGESTION2: not vector. SUGGESTION3: coverage OK. SUGGESTION4: high user/alpha counts (120/308 and 85/259) suggest signal replicability. Confidence: 0.72

Short-term momentum in number of institutional buyers using ts_delta to capture recent buyer increases. SUGGESTION1: single-field short-term signal. SUGGESTION2: not vector. SUGGESTION3: coverage=1.0. SUGGESTION4: inst6_num_of_institutional_buyers has very high user/alpha (180/482) → reliable. Confidence: 0.74

Acceleration in institutional holders over 10 days to find building conviction. SUGGESTION1: single time-series field. SUGGESTION2: not vector. SUGGESTION3: coverage OK. SUGGESTION4: inst6_num_of_institutional_holders (101/240) used for robustness. Confidence: 0.68

Average dollar value bought per institutional buyer: shows large buyers or concentrated buying. SUGGESTION1: combine value and buyer count. SUGGESTION2: not vector. SUGGESTION3: coverage OK. SUGGESTION4: both fields have decent counts (92/279 and 180/482) → reliable. Confidence: 0.76

Average dollar value sold per institutional seller to detect large-scale exits. Applied SUGGESTION1 with two fields. SUGGESTION4: inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_sold (84/299) and inst6_num_of_institutional_sellers (110/258) used. Confidence: 0.70
Simple net change in institutional participation by subtracting sellers from buyers. SUGGESTION1 applied. SUGGESTION4: uses high-count buyer/seller fields. Confidence: 0.66
Cross-sectional z-score of net dollar flow to identify relative buying pressure. SUGGESTION1: combined two fields. SUGGESTION4: both high usage. SUGGESTION2/3 not needed. Confidence: 0.75

Institutional shares bought divided by total shares held by institutions to measure incoming turnover. SUGGESTION1 applied. SUGGESTION4: inst6_num_of_institutional_shares_bought (120/308) and inst6_total_shares_held_by_institutions (88/219). Confidence: 0.71

results.idea: Dollar flow share of institutional book
results.description: Value bought divided by value held by institutions to capture scale of purchases relative to book. SUGGESTION1 used two fields. SUGGESTION4: inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought and inst6_value_held_by_institutions chosen. Confidence: 0.73

results.idea: Rapid decrease in holders (early exit signal)
results.description: Negative ts_delta of institutional holders over 5 days to catch rapid exits. SUGGESTION1: single field; SUGGESTION4: good user/alpha. Confidence: 0.67

High ts_std_dev of institutional shares bought over 20 days indicates episodic large purchases (possible informed buying). SUGGESTION1 used single field. SUGGESTION4: field has high counts. Confidence: 0.64
ts_ir(inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought,20) measures consistency of buying (mean / std). SUGGESTION1 single field. SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence: 0.69
ts_corr between value bought and holder counts over 30 days: buys accompanied by more holders suggests genuine accumulation. SUGGESTION1 used two fields. Coverage OK. Confidence: 0.66

inst6_value_held_by_institutions divided by aggregate_equity_value_institutions shows institutional concentration relative to aggregate equity value. SUGGESTION1 applied using a high-coverage aggregate field (coverage 1.0). Confidence: 0.65
ts_delta of inst6_value_held_by_institutions over 7 days to detect rapid inflows/outflows. SUGGESTION1 single time-series field. SUGGESTION4: decent userCount. Confidence: 0.68

Cross-sectional zscore of ratio value_bought/value_sold to spot relative accumulators. SUGGESTION1 used two fields. SUGGESTION4 high alpha counts improve cross-sectional normalization. Confidence: 0.74

results.idea: Institutional buying lead indicator (buyers then price)
results.description: ts_arg_max on buyers to detect recent peaks in buyer counts (short lead). SUGGESTION1 single field used. SUGGESTION4 high counts. Confidence: 0.60
inst6_num_of_institutional_buyers divided by inst6_num_of_institutional_holders to capture participation intensity. SUGGESTION1 used both fields with good counts. Confidence: 0.69
ts_delta of inst6_num_of_institutional_sellers over 5 days to detect building selling pressure. SUGGESTION1 single field. SUGGESTION4 fields have high counts. Confidence: 0.66

Market quantity acquired minus disposed to measure net supply/demand from institutions. SUGGESTION1 used quantity_institutional_shares_acquired and quantity_institutional_shares_disposed (coverage 1.0). SUGGESTION4 userCounts low but field is direct flow measure. Confidence: 0.62
zscore(quantity_institutional_shares_acquired) to rank stocks by recent institutional acquisition intensity. SUGGESTION1 single field; SUGGESTION4 userCount modest. Confidence: 0.58

Normalize shares bought by aggregate share count to control for company size. SUGGESTION1: inst6_num_of_institutional_shares_bought / aggregate_share_count_all_owners. Both coverage 1.0; applied SUGGESTION4 picking well-used bought field. Confidence: 0.70

results.idea: Value bought per total shares (impact proxy)
results.description: inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought divided by aggregate_share_count_all_owners to estimate price impact per share. SUGGESTION1 used both fields; coverage OK. Confidence: 0.67

Percent change: ts_delta(inst6_total_shares_held_by_institutions, 1) / ts_delay(inst6_total_shares_held_by_institutions,1) to identify meaningful shifts. SUGGESTION1 used one field with ts operators. Confidence: 0.63

results.idea: Rapid increase in institutional dollar holdings (zscore)
results.description: zscore(ts_delta(inst6_value_held_by_institutions, 7)) to find outsized inflows. SUGGESTION1: single field ts_delta then cross-sectional zscore. Confidence: 0.71
last_diff_value of net dollar flow to detect whether recent net flow direction changed vs previous value. SUGGESTION1 single field created as subtract(value_bought, value_sold). Confidence: 0.55

results.idea: Persistent reduction in institutional value (20d avg)
results.description: ts_mean(inst6_value_held_by_institutions,20) low relative to current value indicates recent drop; use subtract(current, mean). SUGGESTION1 single field. Confidence: 0.60
winsorize(subtract(value_bought,value_sold)) to reduce outlier influence then cross-sectional rank implied by zscore. SUGGESTION1: applied winsorize to robustify; fields high-count. Confidence: 0.68

results.idea: Inst buying relative to all-owners equity value
results.description: inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought divided by aggregate_equity_value_all_owners measures buying intensity vs total market value. SUGGESTION1 used aggregate field coverage 1.0. Confidence: 0.66
inst6_num_of_institutional_holders divided by aggregate_share_count_all_owners indicates how concentrated ownership is relative to float. SUGGESTION1 used two fields. Confidence: 0.61
zscore(divide(inst6_num_of_institutional_shares_bought, inst6_total_shares_held_by_owners)) to compare turnover cross-sectionally. SUGGESTION1 combined buys and total held by owners. Confidence: 0.69

results.idea: Net value flow normalized by total held
results.description: subtract(value_bought, value_sold) divided by inst6_value_held_by_owners gives net inflow per dollar held. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.72
ts_arg_max(inst6_num_of_institutional_shares_bought, 10) to detect if today is recent peak in buys. SUGGESTION1 single field. Confidence: 0.58
ts_delta(inst6_num_of_institutional_buyers, 20) to spot sustained change in buyer participation. SUGGESTION1 single field with large userCount. Confidence: 0.65

results.idea: Dollar sold intensity relative to book (zscore)
results.description: zscore(divide(inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_sold, inst6_value_held_by_institutions)) identifies outsized selling relative to institutional book. SUGGESTION1 used two fields with good counts. Confidence: 0.70

divide(subtract(inst6_num_of_institutional_shares_bought, inst6_num_of_institutional_shares_sold), inst6_total_shares_held_by_institutions) to get normalized net flow. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.68
divide(inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought, inst6_num_of_institutional_holders) to see average inflow per holder. SUGGESTION1 used two fields. Confidence: 0.64
divide(inst6_num_of_institutional_sellers, inst6_num_of_institutional_holders) to identify widening exit participation. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.63

multiply(inst6_num_of_institutional_buyers, inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought) to emphasize stocks with many buyers and large buys. SUGGESTION1: multiplication of two strong fields. Confidence: 0.66
multiply(inst6_num_of_institutional_sellers, inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_sold) to highlight coordinated exits. SUGGESTION1 used two fields. Confidence: 0.64
ts_zscore(divide(inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought, inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_sold), 10) to detect unusual recent buying relative to selling. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.72
ts_std_dev(inst6_num_of_institutional_holders, 30) low volatility indicates sticky holders (positive). SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.59

ts_corr(inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought, aggregate_equity_value_all_owners, 30) to see if buys track market cap changes (structural). SUGGESTION1 used aggregate field to normalize. Confidence: 0.56

divide(ts_delta(inst6_num_of_institutional_buyers, 3), aggregate_share_count_all_owners) to get short-term participation per share. SUGGESTION1 used ts_delta and aggregate share count. Confidence: 0.62
ts_count_nans(inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought, 20) low count means consistent buys. SUGGESTION1 applied; coverage full so ts_backfill not needed. Confidence: 0.55
multiply(inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought, inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_sold) to highlight volatile trading pairs (both high). SUGGESTION1 used two fields. Confidence: 0.50
divide(inst6_num_of_institutional_holders, aggregate_equity_value_all_owners) to compare holder counts to company size. SUGGESTION1 used both fields. Confidence: 0.57

subtract(divide(inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought, aggregate_share_count_all_owners), divide(inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_sold, aggregate_share_count_all_owners)) to get net per-share dollar flow. SUGGESTION1 used two ratios. Confidence: 0.69
subtract(ts_delta(inst6_num_of_institutional_buyers,5), ts_delta(inst6_num_of_institutional_sellers,5)) to find net participation momentum. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.65
subtract(ts_max_diff(inst6_value_held_by_institutions, 60), 0) where ts_max_diff gives current minus max (negative = drawdown). SUGGESTION1 used single field. Confidence: 0.61
divide(ts_sum(inst6_num_of_institutional_buyers, 10), ts_sum(inst6_num_of_institutional_sellers, 10)) to see persistent net buying over 10 days. SUGGESTION1 used both sums. Confidence: 0.67

results.idea: Value buys relative to owners' value
results.description: divide(inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought, inst6_value_held_by_owners) to assess purchase magnitude vs total owner value. SUGGESTION1 using owners field preferred for normalization. Confidence: 0.68

results.idea: Buyers to shares held ratio (cross-section zscore)
results.description: zscore(divide(inst6_num_of_institutional_buyers, inst6_total_shares_held_by_institutions)) to find stocks where many buyers act on small holdings. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.63

results.idea: High seller value but low seller count (large exits)
results.description: divide(inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_sold, inst6_num_of_institutional_sellers) high indicates few large sellers. SUGGESTION1 used both fields. Confidence: 0.66

results.idea: Buy intensity vs owners trend (ts_regression slope)
results.description: ts_regression(inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought, inst6_value_held_by_institutions, 30) and inspect slope (rettype parameter could be slope) to see buys leading holdings. SUGGESTION1 used regression operator; fields with good counts. Confidence: 0.60

quantile(divide(inst6_num_of_institutional_shares_bought, inst6_num_of_institutional_shares_sold),  gaussian) to put imbalance on a percentile scale. SUGGESTION1 used ratio and quantile operator for comparability. Confidence: 0.64

results.idea: Consistent accumulation (low std of net value)
results.description: ts_std_dev(subtract(inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought, inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_sold), 30) low std indicates steady accumulation. SUGGESTION1 used net flow. Confidence: 0.62
divide(inst6_num_of_institutional_shares_bought, aggregate_share_count_all_owners) to measure concentration of bought shares relative to total shares. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.65

results.idea: Sudden large dollar buys (ts_arg_max on values)
results.description: ts_arg_max(inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought, 30) identifies recent spikes in dollar buying. SUGGESTION1 used single field. Confidence: 0.60

results.idea: Buy-sell net as fraction of institutional book (zscore)
results.description: zscore(divide(subtract(inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought, inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_sold), inst6_value_held_by_institutions)) to find significant net flows relative to book. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.73

signed_power(subtract(inst6_num_of_institutional_shares_bought, inst6_num_of_institutional_shares_sold), 0.5) to compress magnitude but keep sign for robust ranking. SUGGESTION1 used signed_power to dampen outliers. Confidence: 0.61
zscore(subtract(inst6_num_of_institutional_shares_bought, inst6_num_of_institutional_shares_sold)) cross-sectionally ranks net transactional activity. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.66

results.idea: Buyers per value bought (average buyer size)
results.description: divide(inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought, inst6_num_of_institutional_buyers) gives mean dollar per buyer to flag few big buyers. SUGGESTION1 used two fields with high counts. Confidence: 0.74

results.idea: Sellers per value sold (average seller size)
results.description: divide(inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_sold, inst6_num_of_institutional_sellers) to identify few large sellers. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.68
divide(ts_delta(inst6_value_held_by_institutions, 7), ts_delay(inst6_value_held_by_institutions, 7)) to get 7-day percent change. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.66
zscore(divide(inst6_num_of_institutional_shares_bought, inst6_num_of_institutional_holders)) to find concentrated buying among holders. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.67
days_from_last_change(inst6_num_of_institutional_holders) to spot freshly changed holder counts (recent activity). SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.52

results.idea: Net buy zscore per outstanding shares
results.description: zscore(divide(subtract(inst6_num_of_institutional_shares_bought, inst6_num_of_institutional_shares_sold), aggregate_share_count_all_owners)) to compare net flows per share cross-sectionally. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.70
ts_returns(inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought, 5) to capture percentage change in buying activity. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.59
subtract(ts_returns(inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought,5), ts_returns(inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_sold,5)) to find momentum tilt. SUGGESTION1 used two returns. Confidence: 0.62

results.idea: Inst shares bought per owner value
results.description: divide(inst6_num_of_institutional_shares_bought, aggregate_equity_value_all_owners) to size purchases by market value. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.56
quantile(subtract(inst6_num_of_institutional_shares_bought, inst6_num_of_institutional_shares_sold), gaussian) for robust cross-sectional ranking. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.68
divide(inst6_total_shares_held_by_institutions, aggregate_share_count_all_owners) to measure institutional stake fraction. SUGGESTION1 used two full-coverage fields. Confidence: 0.71
subtract(inst6_num_of_institutional_buyers, ts_mean(inst6_num_of_institutional_buyers,20)) to spot recent surges vs historical. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.66

divide(subtract(inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought, inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_sold), inst6_num_of_institutional_buyers) to measure net per buyer. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.69
divide(inst6_num_of_institutional_sellers, aggregate_share_count_all_owners) to gauge exit participation relative to shares. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.58
ts_av_diff(subtract(inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought, inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_sold), 10) to measure deviation from 10-day mean. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.65
divide(inst6_num_of_institutional_buyers, inst6_num_of_institutional_holders) to measure activation ratio. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.62
ts_decay_linear(inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought, 10) to produce smoothed recent buying signal. SUGGESTION1 applied; decay reduces noise. Confidence: 0.60
zscore(ts_delta(inst6_value_held_by_institutions, 30)) to find stocks with unusually fast growth in institutional holdings. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.70

divide(subtract(inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought, inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_sold), inst6_num_of_institutional_holders) to normalize net flows. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.68
ts_arg_max(inst6_num_of_institutional_sellers, 15) to detect peak selling days. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.55

results.idea: Buyers weighted by value (multiply then zscore)
results.description: zscore(multiply(inst6_num_of_institutional_buyers, inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought)) to rank by combined breadth and size of buys. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.67

results.idea: Low holder count but large buys (contrarian)
results.description: divide(inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought, inst6_num_of_institutional_holders) high with low holders suggests potential takeovers; use zscore for cross-section. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.63

divide(market_value_institutional_shares_acquired, inst6_value_held_by_institutions) to measure acquisition significance relative to book. SUGGESTION1 applied using market_value_institutional_shares_acquired field (coverage 1.0). Confidence: 0.60
divide(market_value_institutional_shares_disposed, inst6_value_held_by_institutions) to flag meaningful disposals. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.61

ts_product(divide(inst6_num_of_institutional_shares_bought, inst6_total_shares_held_by_institutions), 5) product over 5 days to spot continued accumulation (values >1 accumulate). SUGGESTION1 used ratio product. Confidence: 0.58

results.idea: Buyers to total owners value (signal strength)
results.description: divide(inst6_num_of_institutional_buyers, aggregate_equity_value_all_owners) to compare buyer counts to market size. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.54

results.idea: Net flow per institutional share held (momentum)
results.description: divide(subtract(inst6_num_of_institutional_shares_bought, inst6_num_of_institutional_shares_sold), inst6_total_shares_held_by_institutions) to normalize net quantity flow. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.66
ts_kurtosis(inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought, 30) high kurtosis indicates episodic extreme buys (informational). SUGGESTION1 used single field. Confidence: 0.53

results.idea: Inst buying relative to aggregate institutional value
results.description: divide(inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought, aggregate_equity_value_institutions) to standardize by institutional market cap. SUGGESTION1 used aggregate field with full coverage. Confidence: 0.59
subtract(ts_returns(inst6_num_of_institutional_shares_bought, 5), ts_returns(inst6_num_of_institutional_shares_sold, 5)) to capture divergence in growth rates. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.61

results.idea: Stable holdings with increasing buys (mean reversion)
results.description: and( ts_std_dev(inst6_num_of_institutional_holders,30) < 1, ts_delta(inst6_num_of_institutional_shares_bought,7) > 0 ) to find stable holder base with rising buys. SUGGESTION1 used two measures; logical operator keeps to 2 fields. Confidence: 0.57
ts_av_diff(inst6_num_of_institutional_shares_bought, 14) to measure deviation from 14-day average purchases. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.60

results.idea: Inst holders to total shares zscore
results.description: zscore(divide(inst6_num_of_institutional_holders, aggregate_share_count_all_owners)) cross-sectionally ranks holder concentration. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.62

results.idea: Net dollar flow per total shares zscore
results.description: zscore(divide(subtract(inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought, inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_sold), aggregate_share_count_all_owners)) to find extreme net per-share flows. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.71

results.idea: Inst buy pressure normalized by institutional book zscore
results.description: zscore(divide(inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought, inst6_value_held_by_institutions)) to rank buys relative to institutional holdings. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.72
ts_sum(inst6_num_of_institutional_shares_sold, 10) large sum indicates sustained selling pressure. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.60
subtract(market_value_institutional_shares_acquired, market_value_institutional_shares_disposed) to get net market-value acquisitions. SUGGESTION1 used two market-value fields. Confidence: 0.63

zscore(subtract(inst6_num_of_institutional_buyers, inst6_num_of_institutional_sellers)) to find relative shifts in participation. SUGGESTION1 applied using fields with high userCounts. Confidence: 0.65
divide(inst6_value_held_by_institutions, aggregate_share_count_all_owners) to see institutional dollar per share (support level). SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.68

results.idea: Large institutional buys with few buyers (informational)
results.description: and(greater(inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought, ts_mean(inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought,20)), less(inst6_num_of_institutional_buyers, ts_mean(inst6_num_of_institutional_buyers,20))) to flag few big buyers. SUGGESTION1 applied with two fields and ts_mean. Confidence: 0.64
divide(ts_sum(inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought,10), inst6_value_held_by_institutions) to measure 10-day accumulation vs book. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.70
quantile(ts_delta(inst6_num_of_institutional_buyers,7), gaussian) to rank stocks by 7-day buyer growth. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.63

trade_when(subtract(inst6_num_of_institutional_shares_bought, inst6_num_of_institutional_shares_sold), greater(subtract(inst6_num_of_institutional_shares_bought, inst6_num_of_institutional_shares_sold), 0), 0) to keep net positive flows and mask others. SUGGESTION1 used to filter positives. Confidence: 0.54

zscore(winsorize(divide(inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought, inst6_value_held_by_institutions))) to reduce outlier effects and rank. SUGGESTION1 applied; winsorize used per SUGGESTION to control outliers. Confidence: 0.69

abs(subtract(inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought, inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_sold)) to capture high activity magnitude regardless of direction. SUGGESTION1 used two fields. Confidence: 0.56

results.idea: Recent holder base shrinkage relative to book
results.description: divide(ts_delta(inst6_total_shares_held_by_institutions, 14), inst6_total_shares_held_by_institutions) negative values highlight shrinking institutional stake. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.62
